about.nevj10: Secondary Vocational School for Foreign Trade by 'The Jewish Communities in Budapest'
about.nevj16: The website was developed by Cintia Kiss and Péter Berta, who created a modern, user-friendly digital library system for the Secondary Vocational School for Foreign Trade by 'The Jewish Communities in Budapest'. The system allows teachers to easily borrow books, simplifies the registration and availability of books. The platform aims to provide quick and convenient access to books, while ensuring the transparency and efficiency of the borrowing processes.

home.bemut1: The Secondary Vocational School for Foreign Trade by 'The Jewish Communities in Budapest' aims to offer high-level, practice-oriented training in the fields of economics, finance, logistics, and international trade. Our programs are tailored to meet market demands, providing students with the necessary theoretical and practical knowledge to lay the foundation for a successful career in both the international and domestic labor markets.
home.bemut2: During the training, students will acquire skills in financial analysis, international trade regulations, business communication, and project management, while also learning to use modern industry software. The state-supported, free vocational education is available in both full-time and part-time formats, with scholarship and internship opportunities.
home.bemut3: Our school maintains close relationships with major companies, enabling students to gain valuable professional experience and enter the workforce with competitive knowledge.
